objdescid.compdate: 1810The work is *signed* and dated "Fresco by Will^m^ Blake 1810" on the tree limb just below the top margin.

objinfo.medium: water-based tempera with a glue and/or gum binder and with some pen and ink outlining

provenance.name: Glasgow District Council, Pollok House
provenance.note: Acquired from Blake by Thomas Butts; by inheritance to Thomas Butts, Jr., in 1845; sold from the collection of Thomas Butts, Jr., Foster and Son auction, London, 29 June 1853, lot 77 (with lot 76, *Eve Naming the Birds*, for 10s. the pair, to William Stirling-Maxwell); by inheritance to John Stirling-Maxwell in 1878; Mrs. A. Maxwell Macdonald; given by Macdonald in 1967 to the Corporation of Glasgow (now Glasgow District Council) and housed at Pollok House, Glasgow.

objnote.p: The painting is based on Genesis 2:19-20. Blake illustrated the same subject in his frontispiece to William Hayley, *Designs to a Series of Ballad*, 1802. *Adam Naming the Beasts* is a companion to *Eve Naming the Birds* (Butlin 668); both are part of a series of four paintings also including *The Virgin and Child in Egypt* (Butlin 669) and *Christ Blessing* (Butlin 670).
